element.awards: Nominated for 7 Oscars. Another 16 wins & 16 nominations.
element.plot: Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency.
element.title: The Shawshank Redemption

element.plot: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son.
element.title: The Godfather

element.plot: The early life and career of Vito Corleone in 1920s New York is portrayed while his son, Michael, expands and tightens his grip on his crime syndicate stretching from Lake Tahoe, Nevada to pre-revolution 1958 Cuba.
element.title: The Godfather: Part II

element.plot: When the menace known as the Joker wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, the caped crusader must come to terms with one of the greatest psychological tests of his ability to fight injustice.
element.title: The Dark Knight

element.plot: The lives of two mob hit men, a boxer, a gangster's wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.
element.title: Pulp Fiction

element.awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 18 wins & 6 nominations.
element.plot: A dissenting juror in a murder trial slowly manages to convince the others that the case is not as obviously clear as it seemed in court.
element.title: 12 Angry Men

element.plot: In Poland during World War II, Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.
element.title: Schindler's List

element.plot: A bounty hunting scam joins two men in an uneasy alliance against a third in a race to find a fortune in gold buried in a remote cemetery.
element.title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly

element.plot: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring.
element.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 7 wins & 18 nominations.
element.plot: An insomniac office worker looking for a way to change his life crosses paths with a devil-may-care soap maker and they form an underground fight club that evolves into something much, much more...
element.title: Fight Club

element.plot: A meek hobbit of the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to Mount Doom to destroy the One Ring and the dark lord Sauron.
element.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring

element.plot: After the rebels have been brutally overpowered by the Empire on their newly established base, Luke Skywalker takes advanced Jedi training with Master Yoda, while his friends are pursued by Darth Vader as part of his plan to capture Luke.
element.title: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back

element.plot: Forrest Gump, while not intelligent, has accidentally been present at many historic moments, but his true love, Jenny Curran, eludes him.
element.title: Forrest Gump

element.plot: A thief who steals corporate secrets through use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a CEO.
element.title: Inception

element.plot: Upon admittance to a mental institution, a brash rebel rallies the patients to take on the oppressive head nurse.
element.title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

element.plot: While Frodo and Sam edge closer to Mordor with the help of the shifty Gollum, the divided fellowship makes a stand against Sauron's new ally, Saruman, and his hordes of Isengard.
element.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers

element.plot: Henry Hill and his friends work their way up through the mob hierarchy.
element.title: Goodfellas

element.plot: A computer hacker learns from mysterious rebels about the true nature of his reality and his role in the war against its controllers.
element.title: The Matrix

element.plot: Luke Skywalker joins forces with a Jedi Knight, a cocky pilot, a wookiee and two droids to save the universe from the Empire's world-destroying battle-station, while also attempting to rescue Princess Leia from the evil Darth Vader.
element.title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope

element.awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 6 wins & 5 nominations.
element.plot: A poor village under attack by bandits recruits seven unemployed samurai to help them defend themselves.
element.title: Seven Samurai

element.awards: Nominated for 5 Oscars. Another 17 wins & 67 nominations.
element.plot: A team of explorers travel through a wormhole in an attempt to ensure humanity's survival.
element.title: Interstellar

element.awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 65 wins & 28 nominations.
element.plot: Two boys growing up in a violent neighborhood of Rio de Janeiro take different paths: one becomes a photographer, the other a drug dealer.
element.title: City of God

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 27 wins & 18 nominations.
element.plot: Two detectives, a rookie and a veteran, hunt a serial killer who uses the seven deadly sins as his modus operandi.
element.title: Se7en

element.plot: A sole survivor tells of the twisty events leading up to a horrific gun battle on a boat, which begin when five criminals meet at a seemingly random police lineup.
element.title: The Usual Suspects

element.plot: A young F.B.I. cadet must confide in an incarcerated and manipulative killer to receive his help on catching another serial killer who skins his victims.
element.title: The Silence of the Lambs

element.plot: An angel helps a compassionate but despairingly frustrated businessman by showing what life would have been like if he never existed.
element.title: It's a Wonderful Life

element.plot: Epic story of a mysterious stranger with a harmonica who joins forces with a notorious desperado to protect a beautiful widow from a ruthless assassin working for the railroad.
element.title: Once Upon a Time in the West

element.plot: Mathilda, a 12-year-old girl, is reluctantly taken in by L√©on, a professional assassin, after her family is murdered. L√©on and Mathilda form an unusual relationship, as she becomes his prot√©g√©e and learns the assassin's trade.
element.title: L√©on: The Professional

element.plot: A Jewish man has a wonderful romance with the help of his humour, but must use that same quality to protect his son in a Nazi concentration camp.
element.title: Life Is Beautiful

element.plot: Set in unoccupied Africa during the early days of World War II: An American expatriate meets a former lover, with unforeseen complications.
element.title: Casablanca

element.plot: Archaeologist and adventurer Indiana Jones is hired by the US government to find the Ark of the Covenant before the Nazis.
element.title: Raiders of the Lost Ark

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 3 wins & 9 nominations.
element.plot: A former neo-nazi skinhead tries to prevent his younger brother from going down the same wrong path that he did.
element.title: American History X

element.plot: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.
element.title: Saving Private Ryan

element.plot: With the aid of a wealthy erratic tippler, a dewy-eyed tramp who has fallen in love with a sightless flower girl accumulates money to be able to help her medically.
element.title: City Lights

element.plot: In the middle of her family's move to the suburbs, a sullen 10-year-old girl wanders into a world ruled by gods, witches, and monsters; where humans are changed into beasts.
element.title: Spirited Away

element.awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 7 wins & 5 nominations.
element.plot: A Phoenix secretary steals $40,000 from her employer's client, goes on the run and checks into a remote motel run by a young man under the domination of his mother.
element.title: Psycho

element.awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 7 wins & 7 nominations.
element.plot: A wheelchair bound photographer spies on his neighbours from his apartment window and becomes convinced one of them has committed murder.
element.title: Rear Window

element.awards: Nominated for 5 Oscars. Another 52 wins & 72 nominations.
element.plot: A promising young drummer enrolls at a cut-throat music conservatory where his dreams of greatness are mentored by an instructor who will stop at nothing to realize a student's potential.
element.title: Whiplash

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 31 wins & 36 nominations.
element.plot: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.
element.title: The Intouchables

element.plot: The Tramp struggles to live in modern industrial society with the help of a young homeless woman.
element.title: Modern Times

element.plot: A cyborg, identical to the one who failed to kill Sarah Connor, must now protect her nine-year-old son, John, from a more advanced cyborg, made out of liquid metal.
element.title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day

element.awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 50 wins & 42 nominations.
element.plot: A man creates a strange system to help him remember things; so he can hunt for the murderer of his wife without his short-term memory loss being an obstacle.
element.title: Memento

element.awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 15 wins & 23 nominations.
element.plot: The lives of guards on Death Row are affected by one of their charges: a black man accused of child murder and rape, yet who has a mysterious gift.
element.title: The Green Mile

element.plot: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.
element.title: The Pianist

element.plot: An undercover state cop who has infiltrated an Irish gang and a mole in the police force working for the same mob race to track down and identify each other before being exposed to the enemy, after both sides realize their outfit has a rat.
element.title: The Departed

element.plot: During the Vietnam War, Captain Willard is sent on a dangerous mission into Cambodia to assassinate a renegade colonel who has set himself up as a god among a local tribe.
element.title: Apocalypse Now

element.plot: When a Roman general is betrayed and his family murdered by an emperor's corrupt son, he comes to Rome as a gladiator to seek revenge.
element.title: Gladiator

element.plot: A hack screenwriter writes a screenplay for a former silent-film star who has faded into Hollywood obscurity.
element.title: Sunset Blvd.

element.awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 15 wins & 4 nominations.
element.plot: An insane general triggers a path to nuclear holocaust that a war room full of politicians and generals frantically try to stop.
element.title: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb

element.plot: A young man is accidentally sent 30 years into the past in a time-traveling DeLorean invented by his friend, Dr. Emmett Brown, and must make sure his high-school-age parents unite in order to save his own existence.
element.title: Back to the Future

element.plot: The commercial vessel Nostromo receives a distress call from an unexplored planet. After searching for survivors, the crew heads home only to realize that a deadly bioform has joined them.
element.title: Alien

element.awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 6 wins & 21 nominations.
element.plot: Two stage magicians engage in competitive one-upmanship in an attempt to create the ultimate stage illusion.
element.title: The Prestige

element.awards: Nominated for 5 Oscars. Another 5 wins & 1 nomination.
element.plot: Dictator Adenoid Hynkel tries to expand his empire while a poor Jewish barber tries to avoid persecution from Hynkel's regime.
element.title: The Great Dictator

element.plot: Lion cub and future king Simba tests his limits, supported by his family, but sometimes gets in over his head.
element.title: The Lion King

element.plot: In 1984 East Berlin, an agent of the secret police, conducting surveillance on a writer and his lover, finds himself becoming increasingly absorbed by their lives.
element.title: The Lives of Others

element.plot: With the help of a German bounty hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal Mississippi plantation owner.
element.title: Django Unchained

element.plot: A filmmaker recalls his childhood, when he fell in love with the movies at his village's theater and formed a deep friendship with the theater's projectionist.
element.title: Cinema Paradiso

element.plot: A family heads to an isolated hotel for the winter where an evil and spiritual presence influences the father into violence, while his psychic son sees horrific forebodings from the past and of the future.
element.title: The Shining

element.awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 43 wins & 82 nominations.
element.plot: Eight years after the Joker's reign of anarchy, the Dark Knight is forced to return from his imposed exile to save Gotham City from the brutal guerrilla terrorist Bane with the help of the enigmatic Catwoman.
element.title: The Dark Knight Rises

element.awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 3 wins & 2 nominations.
element.plot: When soldiers in World War I refuse to continue with an impossible attack, their superior officers decide to make an example of them.
element.title: Paths of Glory

element.plot: A sexually frustrated suburban father has a mid-life crisis after becoming infatuated with his daughter's best friend.
element.title: American Beauty

element.plot: In the distant future, a small waste collecting robot inadvertently embarks on a space journey that will ultimately decide the fate of mankind.
element.title: WALL¬∑E

element.awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 8 wins & 4 nominations.
element.plot: A hapless New York advertising executive is mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies, and is pursued across the country while he looks for a way to survive.
element.title: North by Northwest

element.plot: The planet from Alien (1979) has been colonized, but contact is lost. This time, the rescue team has impressive firepower, but will it be enough?
element.title: Aliens

element.plot: Following the death of a publishing tycoon, news reporters scramble to discover the meaning of his final utterance.
element.title: Citizen Kane

element.awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 8 wins & 3 nominations.
element.plot: A retired San Francisco detective suffering from acrophobia investigates the strange activities of an old friend's wife, all the while becoming dangerously obsessed with her.
element.title: Vertigo

element.awards: Nominated for 5 Oscars. Another 55 wins & 57 nominations.
element.plot: Amelie is an innocent and naive girl in Paris with her own sense of justice. She decides to help those around her and, along the way, discovers love.
element.title: Am√©lie

element.plot: A tragic film covering a young boy and his little sister's struggle to survive in Japan during World War II.
element.title: Grave of the Fireflies

element.plot: When the police in a German city are unable to catch a child-murderer, other criminals join in the manhunt.
element.title: M

element.awards: Nominated for 6 Oscars. Another 13 wins & 5 nominations.
element.plot: The claustrophobic world of a WWII German U-boat; boredom, filth, and sheer terror.
element.title: Das Boot

element.plot: After being kidnapped and imprisoned for 15 years, Oh Dae-Su is released, only to find that he must find his captor in 5 days.
element.title: Oldboy

element.plot: On a journey to find the cure for a Tatarigami's curse, Ashitaka finds himself in the middle of a war between the forest gods and Tatara, a mining colony. In this quest he also meets San, the Mononoke Hime.
element.title: Princess Mononoke

element.plot: The toys are mistakenly delivered to a day-care center instead of the attic right before Andy leaves for college, and it's up to Woody to convince the other toys that they weren't abandoned and to return home.
element.title: Toy Story 3

element.awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 15 wins & 14 nominations.
element.plot: After rescuing Han Solo from the palace of Jabba the Hutt, the rebels attempt to destroy the second Death Star, while Luke struggles to make Vader shake off of the dark side of the Force.
element.title: Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi

element.awards: Nominated for 2 Golden Globes. Another 13 wins & 4 nominations.
element.plot: A former Prohibition-era Jewish gangster returns to the Lower East Side of Manhattan over thirty years later, where he once again must confront the ghosts and regrets of his old life.
element.title: Once Upon a Time in America

element.plot: After a simple jewelery heist goes terribly wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant.
element.title: Reservoir Dogs

element.awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 12 wins & 13 nominations.
element.plot: In future Britain, charismatic delinquent Alex DeLarge is jailed and volunteers for an experimental aversion therapy developed by the government in an effort to solve society's crime problem - but not all goes according to plan.
element.title: A Clockwork Orange

element.awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 27 wins & 9 nominations.
element.plot: A mentally unstable Vietnam war veteran works as a night-time taxi driver in New York City where the perceived decadence and sleaze feeds his urge for violent action, attempting to save a preadolescent prostitute in the process.
element.title: Taxi Driver

element.plot: When his secret bride is executed for assaulting an English soldier who tried to rape her, William Wallace begins a revolt and leads Scottish warriors against the cruel English tyrant who rules Scotland with an iron fist.
element.title: Braveheart

element.plot: An insurance representative lets himself be talked into a murder/insurance fraud scheme that arouses an insurance investigator's suspicions.
element.title: Double Indemnity

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 32 wins & 47 nominations.
element.plot: The drug-induced utopias of four Coney Island people are shattered when their addictions become stronger.
element.title: Requiem for a Dream

element.plot: Atticus Finch, a lawyer in the Depression-era South, defends a black man against an undeserved rape charge, and his kids against prejudice.
element.title: To Kill a Mockingbird

element.awards: Nominated for 6 Oscars. Another 4 wins & 8 nominations.
element.plot: Leonard Vole is arrested on suspicion of murdering an elderly acquaintance. He employs an experienced but aging barrister as his defense attorney.
element.title: Witness for the Prosecution

element.plot: A flamboyant and controversial British military figure and his conflicted loyalties during his World War I service in the Middle East.
element.title: Lawrence of Arabia

element.plot: When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a procedure to have each other erased from their memories. But it is only through the process of loss that they discover what they had to begin with.
element.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 9 wins & 7 nominations.
element.plot: A pragmatic U.S. Marine observes the dehumanizing effects the U.S.-Vietnam War has on his fellow recruits from their brutal boot camp training to the bloody street fighting in Hue.
element.title: Full Metal Jacket

element.awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 5 wins & 7 nominations.
element.plot: A silent film production company and cast make a difficult transition to sound.
element.title: Singin' in the Rain

element.plot: In 1930s Chicago, a young con man seeking revenge for his murdered partner teams up with a master of the big con to win a fortune from a criminal banker.
element.title: The Sting

element.plot: A man and his son search for a stolen bicycle vital for his job.
element.title: Bicycle Thieves

element.plot: The incredible story of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, told by his peer and secret rival Antonio Salieri - now confined to an insane asylum.
element.title: Amadeus

element.plot: King Arthur and his knights embark on a low-budget search for the Grail, encountering many very silly obstacles.
element.title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail

element.plot: Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers, and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.
element.title: Snatch.

element.plot: Humanity finds a mysterious, obviously artificial, object buried beneath the Lunar surface and, with the intelligent computer H.A.L. 9000, sets off on a quest.
element.title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 10 wins & 2 nominations.
element.plot: A heinous crime and its aftermath are recalled from differing points of view.
element.title: Rashomon

element.plot: Two bounty hunters with the same intentions, team up to track down a Western outlaw.
element.title: For a Few Dollars More

element.plot: As corruption grows in 1950s LA, three policemen - one strait-laced, one brutal, and one sleazy - investigate a series of murders with their own brand of justice.
element.title: L.A. Confidential

element.plot: The Tramp cares for an abandoned child, but events put that relationship in jeopardy.
element.title: The Kid

element.plot: An ingenue insinuates herself in to the company of an established but aging stage actress and her circle of theater friends.
element.title: All About Eve

element.plot: A man tries to rise in his company by letting its executives use his apartment for trysts, but complications and a romance of his own ensue.
element.title: The Apartment

element.plot: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.
element.title: Inglourious Basterds

element.plot: When two musicians witness a mob hit, they flee the state in an all female band disguised as women, but further complications set in.
element.title: Some Like It Hot

element.awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 20 wins & 13 nominations.
element.plot: A cowboy doll is profoundly threatened and jealous when a new spaceman figure supplants him as top toy in a boy's room.
element.title: Toy Story

element.plot: When Dr. Henry Jones Sr. suddenly goes missing while pursuing the Holy Grail, eminent archaeologist Indiana Jones must follow in his father's footsteps and stop the Nazis.
element.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade

element.plot: Fred Dobbs and Bob Curtin, two Americans searching for work in Mexico, convince an old prospector to help them mine for gold in the Sierra Madre Mountains.
element.title: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre

element.plot: A married couple are faced with a difficult decision - to improve the life of their child by moving to another country or to stay in Iran and look after a deteriorating parent who has Alzheimer's disease.
element.title: A Separation

element.plot: Pulp novelist Holly Martins travels to shadowy, postwar Vienna, only to find himself investigating the mysterious death of an old friend, black-market opportunist Harry Lime.
element.title: The Third Man

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 4 wins & 1 nomination.
element.plot: A crafty ronin comes to a town divided by two criminal gangs and decides to play them against each other to free the town.
element.title: Yojimbo

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 15 wins & 48 nominations.
element.plot: After training with his mentor, Batman begins his war on crime to free the crime-ridden Gotham City from corruption that the Scarecrow and the League of Shadows have cast upon it.
element.title: Batman Begins

element.plot: An eight year old boy is thought to be lazy and a troublemaker, until the new art teacher has the patience and compassion to discover the real problem behind his struggles in school.
element.title: Like Stars on Earth

element.plot: In a futuristic city sharply divided between the working class and the city planners, the son of the city's mastermind falls in love with a working class prophet who predicts the coming of a savior to mediate their differences.
element.title: Metropolis

element.plot: Retired Old West gunslinger William Munny reluctantly takes on one last job, with the help of his old partner and a young man.
element.title: Unforgiven

element.awards: Nominated for 3 Golden Globes. Another 3 nominations.
element.plot: In 1980 Miami, a determined Cuban immigrant takes over a drug cartel while succumbing to greed.
element.title: Scarface

element.plot: An emotionally self-destructive boxer's journey through life, as the violence and temper that leads him to the top in the ring, destroys his life outside it.
element.title: Raging Bull

element.plot: Two friends are searching for their long lost companion. They revisit their college days and recall the memories of their friend who inspired them to think differently, even as the rest of the world called them "idiots".
element.title: 3 Idiots

element.plot: To avoid being taken away to a nursing home, an old widower tries to fly his home to Paradise Falls, South America, along with a boy scout who accidentally lifted off with him.
element.title: Up

element.plot: A private detective hired to expose an adulterer finds himself caught up in a web of deceit, corruption and murder.
element.title: Chinatown

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 24 wins & 21 nominations.
element.plot: Traudl Junge, the final secretary for Adolf Hitler, tells of the Nazi dictator's final days in his Berlin bunker at the end of WWII.
element.title: Downfall

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 4 wins & 4 nominations.
element.plot: Allied P.O.W.s plan for several hundred of their number to escape from a German camp during World War II.
element.title: The Great Escape

element.awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 6 wins & 2 nominations.
element.plot: John McClane, officer of the NYPD, tries to save wife Holly Gennaro and several others, taken hostage by German terrorist Hans Gruber during a Christmas party at the Nakatomi Plaza in Los Angeles.
element.title: Die Hard

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 41 wins & 52 nominations.
element.plot: A teacher lives a lonely life, all the while struggling over his son's custody. His life slowly gets better as he finds love and receives good news from his son, but his new luck is about to be brutally shattered by an innocent little lie.
element.title: The Hunt

element.plot: An ex-prize fighter turned longshoreman struggles to stand up to his corrupt union bosses.
element.title: On the Waterfront

element.plot: In the falangist Spain of 1944, the bookish young stepdaughter of a sadistic army officer escapes into an eerie but captivating fantasy world.
element.title: Pan's Labyrinth

element.plot: A group of professional bank robbers start to feel the heat from police when they unknowingly leave a clue at their latest heist.
element.title: Heat

element.plot: A naive man is appointed to fill a vacancy in the US Senate. His plans promptly collide with political corruption, but he doesn't back down.
element.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington

element.plot: After settling his differences with a Japanese PoW camp commander, a British colonel co-operates to oversee his men's construction of a railway bridge for their captors - while oblivious to a plan by the Allies to destroy it.
element.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai

element.plot: Will Hunting, a janitor at M.I.T., has a gift for mathematics, but needs help from a psychologist to find direction in his life.
element.title: Good Will Hunting

element.plot: When two girls move to the country to be near their ailing mother, they have adventures with the wonderous forest spirits who live nearby.
element.title: My Neighbor Totoro

element.plot: A man seeks answers about life, death, and the existence of God as he plays chess against the Grim Reaper during the Black Plague.
element.title: The Seventh Seal

element.plot: The epic adventures of the legendary Baran the Bandit following his release from prison. After serving 35 years, it is no surprise that the world has changed dramatically. Still, Baran ...
element.title: The Bandit

element.awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 3 wins & 1 nomination.
element.plot: The Tramp goes to the Klondike in search of gold and finds it and more.
element.title: The Gold Rush

element.awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 5 wins.
element.plot: A bureaucrat tries to find a meaning in his life after he discovers he has terminal cancer.
element.title: Ikiru

element.awards: Nominated for 8 Oscars. Another 11 wins & 13 nominations.
element.plot: A Victorian surgeon rescues a heavily disfigured man who is mistreated while scraping a living as a side-show freak. Behind his monstrous facade, there is revealed a person of intelligence and sensitivity.
element.title: The Elephant Man

element.plot: A gangster sets out to fulfill his father's dream of becoming a doctor.
element.title: Munna Bhai M.B.B.S.

element.plot: An elderly lord abdicates to his three sons, and the two corrupt ones turn against him.
element.title: Ran

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 12 wins & 2 nominations.
element.plot: After living a life marked by coldness, an aging professor is forced to confront the emptiness of his existence.
element.title: Wild Strawberries

element.awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 10 wins & 15 nominations.
element.plot: A blade runner must pursue and try to terminate four replicants who stole a ship in space and have returned to Earth to find their creator.
element.title: Blade Runner

element.plot: When Union spies steal an engineer's beloved locomotive, he pursues it single-handedly and straight through enemy lines.
element.title: The General

element.awards: Nominated for 5 Oscars. Another 33 wins & 97 nominations.
element.plot: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government.
element.title: The Wolf of Wall Street

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 38 wins & 84 nominations.
element.plot: With his wife's disappearance having become the focus of an intense media circus, a man sees the spotlight turned on him when it's suspected that he may not be innocent.
element.title: Gone Girl

element.awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 13 wins & 7 nominations.
element.plot: A botched card game in London triggers four friends, thugs, weed-growers, hard gangsters, loan sharks and debt collectors to collide with each other in a series of unexpected events, all for the sake of weed, cash and two antique shotguns.
element.title: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels

element.plot: A retired legal counselor writes a novel hoping to find closure for one of his past unresolved homicide cases and for his unreciprocated love with his superior - both of which still haunt him decades later.
element.title: The Secret in Their Eyes

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 4 wins & 7 nominations.
element.plot: Greed, deception, money, power, and murder occur between two mobster best friends and a trophy wife over a gambling empire.
element.title: Casino

element.plot: A retiring police officer reminiscences about the most astounding day of his career, a case that was never filed but continues to haunt him in his memories - the case of a man and a Wednesday.
element.title: A Wednesday

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 22 wins & 10 nominations.
element.plot: Disgruntled Korean War veteran Walt Kowalski sets out to reform his neighbor, a Hmong teenager who tried to steal Kowalski's prized possession: a 1972 Gran Torino.
element.title: Gran Torino

element.plot: "The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire Lebowski, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it.
element.title: The Big Lebowski

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 3 wins & 14 nominations.
element.plot: The youngest son of an alcoholic former boxer returns home, where he's trained by his father for competition in a mixed martial arts tournament - a path that puts the fighter on a collision corner with his older brother.
element.title: Warrior

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 16 wins & 15 nominations.
element.plot: When an unconfident young woman is cursed with an old body by a spiteful witch, her only chance of breaking the spell lies with a self-indulgent yet insecure young wizard and his companions in his legged, walking home.
element.title: Howl's Moving Castle

element.plot: In a future British tyranny, a shadowy freedom fighter, known only by the alias of "V", plots to overthrow it with the help of a young woman.
element.title: V for Vendetta

element.plot: A self-conscious bride is tormented by the memory of her husband's dead first wife.
element.title: Rebecca

element.awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 17 wins & 18 nominations.
element.plot: A young woman from England comes to India to make a documentary about her grandfather's diary which was written in the 1920s about the Indian Independence with five young men.
element.title: Rang De Basanti

element.plot: An in-depth examination of the ways in which the U.S. Vietnam war impacts and disrupts the lives of people in a small industrial town in Pennsylvania.
element.title: The Deer Hunter

element.awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 29 wins & 45 nominations.
element.plot: A hapless young Viking who aspires to hunt dragons becomes the unlikely friend of a young dragon himself, and learns there may be more to the creatures than he assumed.
element.title: How to Train Your Dragon

element.plot: A man refuses to conform to life in a rural prison.
element.title: Cool Hand Luke

element.plot: A spoiled heiress, running away from her family, is helped by a man who's actually a reporter looking for a story.
element.title: It Happened One Night

element.plot: In 1948, an American court in occupied Germany tries four Nazi judges for war crimes.
element.title: Judgment at Nuremberg

element.plot: Jerry Lundegaard's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of the quite pregnant Marge Gunderson.
element.title: Fargo

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 20 wins & 18 nominations.
element.plot: Renton, deeply immersed in the Edinburgh drug scene, tries to clean up and get out, despite the allure of the drugs and influence of friends.
element.title: Trainspotting

element.plot: A manipulative Southern belle carries on a turbulent affair with a blockade runner during the American Civil War.
element.title: Gone with the Wind

element.plot: After a brilliant but asocial mathematician accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.
element.title: A Beautiful Mind

element.awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 26 wins & 84 nominations.
element.plot: After graduating from Emory University, top student and athlete Christopher McCandless abandons his possessions, gives his entire $24,000 savings account to charity and hitchhikes to Alaska to live in the wilderness. Along the way, Christopher encounters a series of characters that shape his life.
element.title: Into the Wild

element.awards: Nominated for 2 Golden Globes. Another 8 wins & 47 nominations.
element.plot: The merciless 1970s rivalry between Formula One rivals James Hunt and Niki Lauda.
element.title: Rush

element.awards: Nominated for 6 Oscars. Another 139 wins & 116 nominations.
element.plot: The life of a young man, Mason, from age 5 to age 18.
element.title: Boyhood

element.plot: A private detective takes on a case that involves him with three eccentric criminals, a gorgeous liar, and their quest for a priceless statuette.
element.title: The Maltese Falcon

element.awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 3 wins & 2 nominations.
element.plot: An ex-tennis pro carries out a plot to murder his wife. When things go wrong, he improvises a brilliant plan B.
element.title: Dial M for Murder

element.awards: Nominated for 6 Oscars. Another 34 wins & 39 nominations.
element.plot: A boy who communicates with spirits that don't know they're dead seeks the help of a disheartened child psychologist.
element.title: The Sixth Sense

element.awards: Won 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 5 wins.
element.plot: In a decrepit South American village, men are hired to transport an urgent nitroglycerine shipment without the equipment that would make it safe.
element.title: The Wages of Fear

element.awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 17 wins & 38 nominations.
element.plot: The true story of Paul Rusesabagina, a hotel manager who housed over a thousand Tutsi refugees during their struggle against the Hutu militia in Rwanda.
element.title: Hotel Rwanda

element.plot: Scientists in the Antarctic are confronted by a shape-shifting alien that assumes the appearance of the people that it kills.
element.title: The Thing

element.plot: After his son is captured in the Great Barrier Reef and taken to Sydney, a timid clownfish sets out on a journey to bring him home.
element.title: Finding Nemo

element.plot: Violence and mayhem ensue after a hunter stumbles upon a drug deal gone wrong and more than two million dollars in cash near the Rio Grande.
element.title: No Country for Old Men

element.plot: A tale of friendship between two unlikely pen pals: Mary, a lonely, eight-year-old girl living in the suburbs of Melbourne, and Max, a forty-four-year old, severely obese man living in New York.
element.title: Mary and Max

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 40 wins & 12 nominations.
element.plot: Twins journey to the Middle East to discover their family history, and fulfill their mother's last wishes.
element.title: Incendies

element.plot: Two Western bank/train robbers flee to Bolivia when the law gets too close.
element.title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 21 wins & 59 nominations.
element.plot: The Bride wakens from a four-year coma. The child she carried in her womb is gone. Now she must wreak vengeance on the team of assassins who betrayed her - a team she was once part of.
element.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1

element.plot: A young recruit in Vietnam faces a moral crisis when confronted with the horrors of war and the duality of man.
element.title: Platoon

element.plot: Brian is born on the original Christmas, in the stable next door. He spends his life being mistaken for a messiah.
element.title: Life of Brian

element.plot: A television network cynically exploits a deranged former anchor's ravings and revelations about the news media for its own profit.
element.title: Network

element.plot: In the antebellum United States, Solomon Northup, a free black man from upstate New York, is abducted and sold into slavery.
element.title: 12 Years a Slave

element.plot: A stark, perverse story of murder, kidnapping, and police corruption in a Mexican border town.
element.title: Touch of Evil

element.plot: The wife of a cruel headmaster and his mistress conspire to kill him, but after the murder is committed, his body disappears, and strange events begin to plague the two women.
element.title: Diabolique

element.plot: A story of family, religion, hatred, oil and madness, focusing on a turn-of-the-century prospector in the early days of the business.
element.title: There Will Be Blood

element.plot: Neurotic New York comedian Alvy Singer falls in love with the ditsy Annie Hall.
element.title: Annie Hall

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 6 wins & 8 nominations.
element.plot: A classic fairy tale, with swordplay, giants, an evil prince, a beautiful princess, and yes, some kissing (as read by a kindly grandfather).
element.title: The Princess Bride

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 4 wins & 10 nominations.
element.plot: After the death of a friend, a writer recounts a boyhood journey to find the body of a missing boy.
element.title: Stand by Me

element.plot: When a Jewish prince is betrayed and sent into slavery by a Roman friend, he regains his freedom and comes back for revenge.
element.title: Ben-Hur

element.awards: Nominated for 9 Oscars. Another 75 wins & 121 nominations.
element.plot: The adventures of Gustave H, a legendary concierge at a famous hotel from the fictional Republic of Zubrowka between the first and second World Wars, and Zero Moustafa, the lobby boy who becomes his most trusted friend.
element.title: The Grand Budapest Hotel

element.plot: Three inseparable childhood friends are just out of college. Nothing comes between them - until they each fall in love, and their wildly different approaches to relationships creates tension.
element.title: Dil Chahta Hai

element.plot: A film that explores the dark and miserable town, Basin City, and tells the story of three different people, all caught up in violent corruption.
element.title: Sin City

element.awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 16 wins & 52 nominations.
element.plot: A group of intergalactic criminals are forced to work together to stop a fanatical warrior from taking control of the universe.
element.title: Guardians of the Galaxy

element.awards: Nominated for 7 Oscars. Another 10 wins & 15 nominations.
element.plot: A man's coerced confession to an IRA bombing he did not commit results in the imprisonment of his father as well. An English lawyer fights to free them.
element.title: In the Name of the Father

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 57 wins & 17 nominations.
element.plot: A horrific car accident connects three stories, each involving characters dealing with loss, regret, and life's harsh realities, all in the name of love.
element.title: Amores Perros

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 7 wins & 3 nominations.
element.plot: Intensely touching story of a misunderstood young adolescent who, left without attention, delves into a life of petty crime.
element.title: The 400 Blows

element.plot: A determined woman works with a hardened boxing trainer to become a professional.
element.title: Million Dollar Baby

element.plot: A drama based on the true story of a college professor's bond with the abandoned dog he takes into his home.
element.title: Hachi: A Dog's Tale

element.plot: A poor Midwest family is forced off of their land. They travel to California, suffering the misfortunes of the homeless in the Great Depression.
element.title: The Grapes of Wrath

element.awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 8 wins & 1 nomination.
element.plot: A nurse is put in charge of an actress who can't talk and finds that the actress's persona is melding with hers.
element.title: Persona

element.plot: Dorothy Gale is swept away to a magical land in a tornado and embarks on a quest to see the Wizard who can help her return home.
element.title: The Wizard of Oz

element.plot: Three WWII veterans return home to small-town America to discover that they and their families have been irreparably changed.
element.title: The Best Years of Our Lives

element.awards: Nominated for 8 Oscars. Another 39 wins & 96 nominations.
element.plot: During World War II, mathematician Alan Turing tries to crack the enigma code with help from fellow mathematicians.
element.title: The Imitation Game

element.plot: Warrior/pacifist Princess Nausica√§ desperately struggles to prevent two warring nations from destroying themselves and their dying planet.
element.title: Nausica√§ of the Valley of the Wind

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 31 wins & 65 nominations.
element.plot: Earth's mightiest heroes must come together and learn to fight as a team if they are to stop the mischievous Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity.
element.title: The Avengers

element.plot: Biography of Mohandas K. Gandhi, the lawyer who became the famed leader of the Indian revolts against the British rule through his philosophy of nonviolent protest.
element.title: Gandhi

element.plot: Jason Bourne dodges a ruthless CIA official and his agents from a new assassination program while searching for the origins of his life as a trained killer.
element.title: The Bourne Ultimatum

element.plot: A troubled teenager is plagued by visions of a large bunny rabbit that manipulates him to commit a series of crimes, after narrowly escaping a bizarre accident.
element.title: Donnie Darko

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 1 win & 1 nomination.
element.plot: A psychotic socialite confronts a pro tennis star with a theory on how two complete strangers can get away with murder...a theory that he plans to implement.
element.title: Strangers on a Train

element.plot: A harried movie director retreats into his memories and fantasies.
element.title: 8¬Ω

element.plot: In 1954, U.S. Marshal Teddy Daniels is investigating the disappearance of a murderess who escaped from a hospital for the criminally insane and is presumed to be hiding near-by.
element.title: Shutter Island

element.awards: Nominated for 9 Oscars. Another 123 wins & 151 nominations.
element.plot: A washed up actor, who once played an iconic superhero, battles his ego and attempts to recover his family, his career and himself in the days leading up to the opening of a Broadway play.
element.title: Birdman

element.plot: A story between a mole in the police department and an undercover cop. Their objectives are the same: to find out who is the mole, and who is the cop.
element.title: Infernal Affairs

element.awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 10 wins & 8 nominations.
element.plot: In a future world devastated by disease, a convict is sent back in time to gather information about the man-made virus that wiped out most of the human population on the planet.
element.title: Twelve Monkeys

element.plot: A guide leads two men through an area known as the Zone to find a room that grants wishes.
element.title: Stalker

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 44 wins & 19 nominations.
element.plot: The people of a small village in Victorian India stake their future on a game of cricket against their ruthless British rulers...
element.title: Lagaan: Once Upon a Time in India

element.plot: When a gigantic great white shark begins to menace the small island community of Amity, a police chief, a marine scientist and grizzled fisherman set out to stop it.
element.title: Jaws

element.plot: A spy organization recruits an unrefined, but promising street kid into the agency's ultra-competitive training program just as a global threat emerges from a twisted tech genius.
element.title: Kingsman: The Secret Service

element.plot: A marshall, personally compelled to face a returning deadly enemy, finds that his own town refuses to help him.
element.title: High Noon

element.plot: A young man and woman meet on a train in Europe, and wind up spending one evening together in Vienna. Unfortunately, both know that this will probably be their only night together.
element.title: Before Sunrise

element.plot: A clash between Sultan (a Qureishi dacoit chief) and Shahid Khan (a Pathan who impersonates him) leads to the expulsion of Khan from Wasseypur, and ignites a deadly blood feud spanning three generations.
element.title: Gangs of Wasseypur

element.plot: A human-looking indestructible cyborg is sent from 2029 to 1984 to assassinate a waitress, whose unborn son will lead humanity in a war against the machines, while a soldier from that war is sent to protect her at all costs.
element.title: The Terminator

element.awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 3 wins & 1 nomination.
element.plot: A woman is asked to spy on a group of Nazi friends in South America. How far will she have to go to ingratiate herself with them?
element.title: Notorious

element.awards: Won 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 6 wins & 7 nominations.
element.plot: A weatherman finds himself living the same day over and over again.
element.title: Groundhog Day

element.plot: The story of King George VI of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, his impromptu ascension to the throne and the speech therapist who helped the unsure monarch become worthy of it.
element.title: The King's Speech

element.plot: Two young Swedish children experience the many comedies and tragedies of their family, the Ekdahls.
element.title: Fanny and Alexander

element.awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 48 wins & 75 nominations.
element.plot: Harry, Ron and Hermione search for Voldemort's remaining Horcruxes in their effort to destroy the Dark Lord as the final battle rages on at Hogwarts.
element.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 2 wins & 19 nominations.
element.plot: The X-Men send Wolverine to the past in a desperate effort to change history and prevent an event that results in doom for both humans and mutants.
element.title: X-Men: Days of Future Past

element.plot: A semi-biographical account of Yip Man, the first martial arts master to teach the Chinese martial art of Wing Chun.
element.title: Ip Man

element.plot: Rocky Balboa, a small-time boxer gets a supremely rare chance to fight the heavy-weight champion, Apollo Creed, in a bout in which he strives to go the distance for his self-respect.
element.title: Rocky

element.plot: Monsters generate their city's power by scaring children, but they are terribly afraid themselves of being contaminated by children, so when one enters Monstropolis, top scarer Sulley finds his world disrupted.
element.title: Monsters, Inc.

element.plot: A religious fanatic marries a gullible widow whose young children are reluctant to tell him where their real daddy hid $10,000 he'd stolen in a robbery.
element.title: The Night of the Hunter

element.awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 10 wins & 3 nominations.
element.plot: In the 1950s, fear and violence escalate as the people of Algiers fight for independence from the French government.
element.title: The Battle of Algiers

element.plot: A man robs a bank to pay for his lover's operation; it turns into a hostage situation and a media circus.
element.title: Dog Day Afternoon

element.plot: After local youth Abdel is beaten unconscious by police, a riot ensues on his estate during which a policeman loses his gun. The gun is found by Vinz who threatens he will kill a cop if Abdel dies.
element.title: La Haine

element.plot: In 1986, in the province of Gyunggi, in South Korea, a second young and beautiful woman is found dead, raped and tied and gagged with her underwear. Detective Park Doo-Man and Detective Cho...
element.title: Memories of Murder

element.plot: An Irish rogue wins the heart of a rich widow and assumes her dead husband's aristocratic position in 18th-century England.
element.title: Barry Lyndon

element.awards: Nominated for 5 Oscars. Another 29 wins & 76 nominations.
element.plot: Blacksmith Will Turner teams up with eccentric pirate "Captain" Jack Sparrow to save his love, the governor's daughter, from Jack's former pirate allies, who are now undead.
element.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl

element.plot: A wandering gunfighter plays two rival families against each other in a town torn apart by greed, pride, and revenge.
element.title: A Fistful of Dollars

element.plot: A bitter aging couple with the help of alcohol, use a young couple to fuel anguish and emotional pain towards each other.
element.title: Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?

element.awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 36 wins & 51 nominations.
element.plot: An insurance salesman/adjuster discovers his entire life is actually a T.V. show.
element.title: The Truman Show

element.plot: A young boy and a girl with a magic crystal must race against pirates and foreign agents in a search for a legendary floating castle.
element.title: Castle in the Sky

element.plot: A care-free girl is sold to a traveling entertainer, consequently enduring physical and emotional pain along the way.
element.title: The Road

element.plot: An aspiring author during the civil rights movement of the 1960s decides to write a book detailing the African-American maids' point of view on the white families for which they work, and the hardships they go through on a daily basis.
element.title: The Help

element.plot: During a preview tour, a theme park suffers a major power breakdown that allows its cloned dinosaur exhibits to run amok.
element.title: Jurassic Park

element.plot: Private detective Philip Marlowe is hired by a rich family. Before the complex case is over, he's seen murder, blackmail, and what might be love.
element.title: The Big Sleep

element.plot: A bored and sheltered princess escapes her guardians and falls in love with an American newsman in Rome.
element.title: Roman Holiday

element.plot: Recent college graduate Benjamin Braddock is trapped into an affair with Mrs. Robinson, who happens to be the wife of his father's business partner and then finds himself falling in love with her daughter, Elaine.
element.title: The Graduate

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 2 wins & 1 nomination.
element.plot: A man befriends a fellow criminal as the two of them begin serving their sentence on a dreadful prison island, which inspires the man to plot his escape.
element.title: Papillon

element.plot: Belle, whose father is imprisoned by the Beast, offers herself instead and discovers her captor to be an enchanted prince.
element.title: Beauty and the Beast

element.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 10 wins & 28 nominations.
element.plot: When Keller Dover's daughter and her friend go missing, he takes matters into his own hands as the police pursue multiple leads and the pressure mounts. But just how far will this desperate father go to protect his family?
element.title: Prisoners

element.plot: An up-and-coming pool player plays a long-time champion in a single high-stakes match.
element.title: The Hustler

element.plot: After killing a night-club owner, professional hitman Jef Costello's seen by witnesses. His efforts to provide himself with an alibi fail and more and more he gets driven into a corner.
element.title: Le Samoura√Ø

element.awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 48 wins & 29 nominations.
element.plot: Two neighbors, a woman and a man, form a strong bond after both suspect extramarital activities of their spouses. However, they agree to keep their bond platonic so as not to commit similar wrongs.
element.title: In the Mood for Love
